ai.summary: A short, easy 3.5 km circular walk along historic quarry sites on Black Mountain. The route offers open views, gentle terrain and minimal climbing, making it suitable for families and casual walkers.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-defined paths with some gravel, occasional rocky patches and a few small rises. Be aware of uneven ground near old quarry edges; surfaces can be muddy after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy footwear and stay on marked paths. Keep a safe distance from quarry edges and supervise children or dogs. Check the weather beforehand, as surfaces can be slippery when wet. Bring a map or GPS, a charged phone, water and snacks, and be mindful that mobile reception may be limited.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn for milder, drier conditions; the route can be walked year-round with proper gear in dry weather.
